```{r}
library(tidyverse, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
setwd("C:/Users/ayersj/OneDrive - Vanderbilt/Papers/SpheneSolubility/DataAnalysis/TitaniteExpts")
# Import normalized EDS glass analyses
TitaniteExpts <- read_csv("TitaniteExptsV2.csv")
```
```{r}
# Convert oxides to cation concentrations
TitaniteCations <- TitaniteExpts %>%
  mutate(
    Si = SiO2/60.0848,
    Al = 2*Al2O3/101.961,
    Na = 2*Na2O/61.979,
    K = 2*K2O/94.194,
    Ca = CaO/56.0794,
    Fe = FeO/71.8464,
    Mg = MgO/40.3044,
    Ti = TiO2/79.8988,
    Mn = MnO/70.9374,
    P = 2*P2O5/141.945,
    CationSum = (Si + Al + Na + K + Ca + Fe + Mg + Ti + Mn + P)
             )
```

```{r}
# Calculate cation fractions
CationFractions <- select(TitaniteCations, Expt, SM, TC, Pkb, H2O, TimeH, Titanite, Rutile, TiO2, Si:CationSum)
f <- match("Si", names(CationFractions))
l <- match("P", names(CationFractions))
for (i in f:l) {
  CationFractions[(i)] = CationFractions[(i)]/CationFractions$CationSum
}

```


```{r}
# Calculate melt composition parameters
CationFractions <- CationFractions %>%
  mutate(
    M = (Na + K + 2*Ca)/(Si*Al),
    FM = (Na + K + 2*(Ca + Fe + Mg))/(Si*Al),
    TK = TC+273.15,
    InvTK = 1/TK,
    PInvTK = (Pkb*1000 - 1)*InvTK
    )
```


```{r}
NoTitanite <- filter(CationFractions, Titanite == "N")
CationFractions <- filter(CationFractions, Titanite == "Y")

# Correlation matrix
CorrTest <- select(CationFractions, TiO2, Pkb, H2O, Ca, Al, M:PInvTK)
cor(CorrTest)
# Glass TiO2 concentration is most highly correlated with melt composition parameter C, but M fits nearly as well.
# Scatterplot matrices
library(car)
scatterplotMatrix(~ Ti + Ca + Al + InvTK + TK + M, data = CationFractions, smooth = FALSE)

```

```{r}
library(leaps)
leaps <- regsubsets(TiO2 ~ TC + Pkb + H2O + M + FM + InvTK, data = CationFractions, nbest = 2) 
plot(leaps, scale = "adjr2")
# summary(leaps)
```


```{r}
fit <- lm(TiO2 ~ M + InvTK + Pkb, data = CationFractions)
summary(fit)
# Pkb is not significant, so drop
fit <- lm(TiO2 ~ M + InvTK, data = CationFractions)
summary(fit)
plot(fit)

```

```{r}
RegModel <- select(CationFractions, Expt, TiO2, InvTK, M)
DelExpts <- c("SpDis_1", "SpDis_2", "SpDis_4")
RegModel <- filter(RegModel, !(Expt %in%  DelExpts))
fit <- lm(TiO2 ~ M + InvTK, data = RegModel)
summary(fit)
plot(fit)
# I think this is our best model. Removing more experiments doesn't significantly improve fit.
write.csv(RegModel, "ExptsInModel.csv")
```

```{r}
# Calculate model TiO2 concentrations and errors
RegModel <- RegModel %>%
  mutate(
   ModelTiO2 = (3.47*M - 8868*InvTK + 3.47),
   ModelTiO2SD = ModelTiO2*sqrt((0.22/3.47)^2 + (1575/8868)^2),
   lower = ModelTiO2 - ModelTiO2SD,
   upper = ModelTiO2 + ModelTiO2SD
  )
```

```{r}
library(plotly)
ggplot(RegModel, aes(x=TiO2, y=ModelTiO2, ymin=lower, ymax=upper)) +
  geom_pointrange() +
  geom_abline(slope=1, intercept=0)
# Convert it to an interactive plot
ggplotly()
```

```{r}
# log-log plot
ggplot(RegModel, aes(x=log(TiO2), y=log(ModelTiO2), ymin=log(lower), ymax=log(upper))) +
  geom_pointrange() +
  geom_abline(slope=1, intercept=0)
ggplotly()
```


```{r}
ggplot(RegModel, aes(x=M, y=TiO2)) +
  geom_point()
  ggplotly()
```

```{r}
# Create model output table
TiO2ModelTable <- select(RegModel, Expt, M, InvTK, TiO2, ModelTiO2, ModelTiO2SD)
write.csv(TiO2ModelTable, file = "TiO2ModelTable.csv")
```
